Key Match Events: Pakistan won the match by 6 wickets (with 10 balls remaining)
Charith Asalanka top scored for Sri Lanka with 79 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan's middle order has suddenly sprung to life
Charith Asalanka is one of the best middle-overs batters in the world at the moment
Sri Lanka might consider writing off their bowling performance against South Africa and starting over
Pakistan will need to see Imam-ul-Haq prove his fitness with runs in a top order that has suddenly run dry
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan head coach Grant Bradburn backs the decision of Shaheen Afridi, Mohammad Rizwan and Imam-ul-Haq not to take part in an optional training session on the eve of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch should be conducive to big scores; New Zealand scored 322 against the Netherlands in Hyderabad on Monday
Sri Lanka have never beaten Pakistan at the ODI World Cup, losing all seven completed matches
